/Users/richardserna2/Code/balanced-api/l.description:
Text that will appear on the buyer's statement.

Characters that can be used are limited to:

- ASCII letters (``a-z`` and ``A-Z``)
- Digits (``0-9``)
- Special characters (``.<>(){}[]+&!$;-%_?:#@~=\'" ^`|``)

Card Debits - Max length 22 characters, truncated to 18 characters with the "BAL*" prefix.

Bank account debits - Max length 14 characters (no truncation).

Credits - Max length 14 characters (no truncation).

All Visa, Master Card, Discover, American Express debits will have a prefix of "BAL*" e.g. "BAL*marketplace.com". ACH debits and credits do not have a prefix. American Express pending transactions will be shown as "BALANCED INC". AMEX pending transactions are hidden by default in the American Express web portal. Once the debit is settled it will convert to "BAL*<appears_on_statement_as>".

enum: Street address matches, but 5-digit and 9-digit postal code do not match.
Street address matches, but postal code not verified.
Street address and postal code do not match.
Street address and postal code match.
AVS data is invalid or AVS is not allowed for this card type.
Card member's name does not match, but billing postal code matches.
Non-U.S. issuing bank does not support AVS.
Card member's name does not match. Street address and postal code match.
Card member's name, billing address, and postal code match. Shipping information verified and chargeback protection guaranteed through the Fraud Protection Program.
Card member's name matches but billing address and billing postal code do not match.
Card member's name and billing postal code match, but billing address does not match.
Street address and postal code match.
Street address and postal code do not match.
Card member's name and billing address match, but billing postal code does not match.
Postal code matches, but street address not verified.
Card member's name, billing address, and postal code match. Shipping information verified but chargeback protection not guaranteed.
U.S.-issuing bank does not support AVS.
Card member's name does not match, but street address matches.
Card member's name, billing address, and billing postal code match.
Street address does not match, but 9-digit postal code matches.
Street address and 9-digit postal code match.
Street address and 5-digit postal code match.
Street address does not match, but 5-digit postal code matches.

appears_on_statement_as.description:
Text that will appear on the buyer's statement.

Characters that can be used are limited to:

- ASCII letters (``a-z`` and ``A-Z``)
- Digits (``0-9``)
- Special characters (``.<>(){}[]+&!$;-%_?:#@~=\'" ^`|``)

Card Debits - Max length 22 characters, truncated to 18 characters with the "BAL*" prefix.

Bank account debits - Max length 14 characters (no truncation).

Credits - Max length 14 characters (no truncation).

All Visa, Master Card, Discover, American Express debits will have a prefix of "BAL*" e.g. "BAL*marketplace.com". ACH debits and credits do not have a prefix. American Express pending transactions will be shown as "BALANCED INC". AMEX pending transactions are hidden by default in the American Express web portal. Once the debit is settled it will convert to "BAL*<appears_on_statement_as>".

destination.description: The funding destination for this credit

order.description: The order this credit is associated with

name.description: Name of the customer or representative of the business.

business_name.description: Full business name if the customer is a business. If there is a business name and EIN present, the customer will be treated as a business instead of a person.

phone.description: Phone number of the person or business.

ssn_last4.description: Last four digits of the Social Security Number of the customer or representative of the business.

ein.description: Employee Identification Number of the business if the customer is a business. If there is a business name and EIN present, the customer will be treated as a business instead of a person.

dob_month.description: Date of birth month of the customer or representative of the business.

dob_year.description: Date of birth year of the customer or representative of the business.

Bank account debits - Max length 14 characters (no truncation).

Credits - Max length 14 characters (no truncation).

All Visa, Master Card, Discover, American Express debits will have a prefix of "BAL*" e.g. "BAL*marketplace.com". ACH debits and credits do not have a prefix. description.__example: Human readable error message about what went wrong. Your request id is OHMasdfasdfasdfasdf

enum: Account balance is insufficient to issue this debit
An account with the given email address already exists.
Bank account authentication amounts do not match.
Bank account authentication amounts do not match.
Bank account authentication is not allowed.
Bank account authentication is not in state ``pending``.
Credit has already been fully reversed.
Debit has already been fully refunded.
Marketplace balance is insufficient to issue this credit
Marketplace escrow balance is insufficient to issue this credit.
Marketplace escrow balance is insufficient to issue this refund.
No buyer or merchant info was provided. Either "merchant/merchant_uri" or"card/card_uri" fields must be present.
Refund amount cannot be greater than the amount of the original debit.
Reverse amount cannot be greater than the amount of the original credit.
State of debit to refund must be ``succeeded``.
The account has no valid funding destinations.
The account has no valid funding sources.
The account is already a merchant.
The bank account is already associated with an account -- it cannot beassociated.
The bank account is not associated with the given account.
The bank account was tokenized on a different marketplace than the oneused for this request.
The card could not be validated -- either the card number or security codemay be wrong.
The card is already associated with an account -- it cannot be associatedagain.
The card is not associated with the given account.
The card was tokenized on a different marketplace than the one used forthis request.
The given funding destination cannot have a credit created against it.
The given funding destination cannot reverse.
The given funding destination is already associated with an account.
The given funding destination is not associated with the account.
The given funding source cannot be refunded.
The given funding source cannot have a debit created against it.
The given funding source cannot have a hold created against it.
The given funding source cannot have an authorization created againstit. Authorizations are only valid for card-type funding sources.
The given funding source is already associated with an account.
The given funding source is not associated with an account.
The merchant information was created on a different marketplace than theone used for this request.
The processor did not accept the transaction.
The processor did not accept this hold.
The routing number provided for the bank account was invalid.
This address could not be verified.
This bank account has already been marked as invalid/deactivated. It cannotbe used again.
This bank account number is not alpha numeric (ascii). It can not be used.
This card has already been marked as invalid/deactivated. It cannot be usedagain.
This card was declined by the processor.
This hold has already been captured or voided, and cannot be captured.
This hold has already been captured or voided, and cannot be voided.
This hold has already been captured, which cannot be reversed.
This hold has already been voided, which cannot be reversed.
This hold is not associated with this account.
This hold is not associated with this marketplace.
Order escrow balanced is insufficient to issue this credit.
Order escrow balanced is insufficient to issue this refund.
Amount exceeds limit. Try breaking up transactions.

Refund amount cannot be greater than the amount of the original debit.
Reverse amount cannot be greater than the amount of the original credit.
State of debit to refund must be ``succeeded``.

The account has no valid funding sources.
The account is already a merchant.

This hold has already been captured or voided, and cannot be captured.

created_at.description: `ISO 8601 <http://www.w3.org/QA/Tips/iso-date>`_ date of when this bank account was tokenized.

routing_number.description: Routing number format. Specified in FedACH database defined by the `US Federal Reserve <http://www.fedwiredirectory.frb.org/>`_.

address.description: A single-level dictionary of string-type key/value pairs representing the address of the person or business.

line1.description: Street address of the person or business.

line2.description: Second line of the address for the person or business.

city.description: City of the person or business.

state.description: State of the person or business.

postal_code.description: Postal code/zip code of the person or business.

fingerprint.description: Uniquely identifies the bank account (``account_number`` and ``routing_number``).

can_debit.description: Flag indicating whether this funding instrument can be debited (true) or not (false).

can_credit.description: Flag indicating whether this funding instrument can be credited (true) or not (false).

meta.description: Single level mapping from string keys to string values.

customer.description: Customer this bank_account is associated with

bank_account_verification.description: Most recent verification for this bank account.

attempts.description: Number of attempts that have been made to verify the bank account.

meta.description: Single level mapping from string keys to string values.

bank_account.description: The bank account this verification is associated with

amount.description: Amount in cents for this card_hold

description.description: A description of the hold, used for display purposes.

failure_reason.description: A human readable error message with the reason for the failure

meta.description: Single level mapping from string keys to string values.

card.description: The funding source for this hold.

debit.description: The debit that was created from this card_hold if it has been captured

amount.description: The amount of the credit in cents.

appears_on_statement_as.description:
Text that will appear on the buyer's statement.

Characters that can be used are limited to:

- ASCII letters (``a-z`` and ``A-Z``)
- Digits (``0-9``)
- Special characters (``.<>(){}[]+&!$;-%_?:#@~=\'" ^`|``)

Card Debits - Max length 22 characters, truncated to 18 characters with the "BAL*" prefix.

Bank account debits - Max length 14 characters (no truncation).

Credits - Max length 14 characters (no truncation).

All Visa, Master Card, Discover, American Express debits will have a prefix of "BAL*" e.g. "BAL*marketplace.com". ACH debits and credits do not have a prefix. American Express pending transactions will be shown as "BALANCED INC". AMEX pending transactions are hidden by default in the American Express web portal. Once the debit is settled it will convert to "BAL*<appears_on_statement_as>".

description.description: Free-text description of the credit for the dashboard.

failure_reason.description: A human readable error message with the reason for the failure

meta.description: Single level mapping from string keys to string values.

customer.description: The customer this funding destination is associated to

destination.description: The funding destination for this credit

order.description: The order this credit is associated with

customers.orders.description: Orders in which the customer is either a buyer or merchant

name.description: Name of the customer or representative of the business.

business_name.description: Full business name if the customer is a business. If there is a business name and EIN present, the customer will be treated as a business instead of a person.

phone.description: Phone number of the person or business.

ssn_last4.description: Last four digits of the Social Security Number of the customer or representative of the business.

ein.description: Employee Identification Number of the business if the customer is a business. If there is a business name and EIN present, the customer will be treated as a business instead of a person.

dob_month.description: Date of birth month of the customer or representative of the business.

dob_year.description: Date of birth year of the customer or representative of the business.

address.description: A single-level dictionary of string-type key/value pairs representing the address of the person or business.

line1.description: Street address of the person or business.

line2.description: Second line of the address for the person or business.

city.description: City of the person or business.

state.description: State of the person or business.

postal_code.description: Postal code/zip code of the person or business.

meta.description: Single level mapping from string keys to string values.

created_at.description: `ISO 8601 <http://www.w3.org/QA/Tips/iso-date>`_ date of when this debit was created.

amount.description: The amount of the debit in cents.

appears_on_statement_as.description:
Text that will appear on the buyer's statement.

Characters that can be used are limited to:

- ASCII letters (``a-z`` and ``A-Z``)
- Digits (``0-9``)
- Special characters (``.<>(){}[]+&!$;-%_?:#@~=\'" ^`|``)

Card Debits - Max length 22 characters, truncated to 18 characters with the "BAL*" prefix.

Bank account debits - Max length 14 characters (no truncation).

Credits - Max length 14 characters (no truncation).

All Visa, Master Card, Discover, American Express debits will have a prefix of "BAL*" e.g. "BAL*marketplace.com". ACH debits and credits do not have a prefix. American Express pending transactions will be shown as "BALANCED INC". AMEX pending transactions are hidden by default in the American Express web portal. Once the debit is settled it will convert to "BAL*<appears_on_statement_as>".
